channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pedestrian Crossing Activating When No One is Present, 2nd November
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing is frequently activating on its own, even when there’s no one waiting to cross. The lights change to red and stop traffic unnecessarily, which is causing delays and confusion for drivers and pedestrians alike. It looks like one of the sensors or push buttons may be faulty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lamp Post, 2nd November
item.description:
Street lamp post outside 21 Northcote Road not working in the evening. Possible lamp blown. The road is very dark without this as there are not many lamppost on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Northcote Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still nothing done o/s 58 haldane, 2nd November
item.description:
We are constantly blighted with flytipping and people not disposing of their rubbish properly. This was reported a couple of weeks back but still nothing has been done and still the pavement is impassable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haldane Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gutters and leaf debris, 2nd November
item.description:
To the rear of 23 Gardiners Close. There is a huge mound of leave and gutter debris that the road cart has missed. Please can you resolve before it becomes a parking hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gardiner Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign fallen over, 2nd November
item.description:
Lanridge Road sign replaced and stuck to old sign with duct tape (insane in and of itself that this was the councils solution). Sign has now fallen and was blocking pathway. Have moved, very heavy. Needs a permanent, safe installation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lanridge Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish outside the house, 2nd November
item.description:
Number 37 It’s never clean outside the house. A big box has been left there for weeks. People walking past just through stuff in there. It’s now full. Rubbish all over the place. Do the people living there expect the dustman to take it away. They won’t touch it and it’s been there for weeks. Just ridiculous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17,19, South Lodge Drive, Cockfosters, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking the path and cross way, again, 2nd November
item.description:
Inconsiderate renters leaving the rental bikes in the way of the crossing. This makes it impossible worth a wheelchair to negotiate safely. Please deal with the companies or better still ban them from the pathways. Regards, Mrs Grange.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ebury Bridge Road, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet
